intro: Acanthodium grossum, commonly known as the rough acanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
distribution_native_art_desc: Acanthodium grossum is primarily native to the semi-arid regions of southern Africa, including countries such as Namibia, Botswana, and South Africa. It is often seen growing along riverbanks and in rocky outcrops where it receives adequate sunlight. Its distribution is largely restricted to these specific ecological zones within its native range.
